intro: Stuckertia, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Stuckertia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
